reviewText:
Enjoyed playing this game overall.

----------------

Spawn time is quick.

Has a level system that unlocks different weapons as you progress and you can customize eight different loadouts in the main menu. Every weapon is unique in its own way and some of their effects are actually fun to use. They can even be used right away during battle after unlocking.

There are different variety of game modes you can try out (Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Zombies, and more) and a bunch of maps that provide a real effect on the battle (Ice on the ground, traps, water). If you create a server you can even mess around with the options for a better experience.

You can talk to players via typing.

Gameplay runs smoothly most of the time on my laptop with settings set to low and windowed.

Downloading and installing is quick and easy.

----------------

Right now the server list is sparce. You have to either wait awile for a server to be open or create your own and wait for more players to join. So you can't just jump right in with other players sometimes.

There was some lag that shows in a way that aiming and movement gets difficult.

You can be spawned-killed easily if you don't move away after invincibility wears off. Even when switching loadouts or weapons.

----------------

Movement is easy, yet difficult to master.

The game can be customized to suit what you want on your screen, like the crosshairs, the color of your character, and  even the sound of landing a hit on your opponent. Think there are others I haven't tried out yet.

There is a map editor. Haven't touched it so I don't know much about it.

----------------

Recommend it if you like the multiplayer experience and/or want to kill some boredom.

reviewText: Boring Man is a game which takes the mechanics of an FPS, removes a dimension (and regenerating health), puts in loads of crazy weapons, and everyone is a stick-man. This game is anything but tactical. It plays a lot like quake with fast paced movement, and rocket jumping. Most of the weapons were fun to use, encouraged new play styles, and had fun little quirks about them. Such as how when you crouch with the  machine gun, it turns it from a suppressor, into a great guarding weapon. All the modes were unique and interesting. You've got Death-match, Team death-match, CTF, survival, zombies, Take over, and weapons deal, which is like COD gun game. The modes again, felt very fun to play and CTF had its own interesting mechanic where there is a generator in each of the bases, this powers the defensive turret, ammo dispenser, and tele-porters, which make games very interesting. However there are some downsides, the game is very glitchy, having internet problems here and there, shots not registring, and more. The game could also be great with a single-player campaign, survival mode alone didn't feel like enough.\n\nOverall, Boring Man is an incredibly fun online 2D shooter, if your a fan of FPS games but want a change, Boring Man has a lot to offer. 8.5/10

reviewText:
It’s navigating the winding roads of Blaine County, your attention split between weaving intently through traffic and desperately flipping between radio stations to find a song you caught a whisper of at the last set of traffic lights. It’s the first time you approach Los Santos from afar, the skyline ablaze with neon, San Andreas’ decadence forgotten as you bask in its warm glow. It’s at these moments that it all sinks in: the grandeur, the scope, and the scale. You come to realise Boring Man OTSC encompasses, for better or worse, everything that’s come to define this console generation. The violence, the scale, the raw ambition and the missed opportunities – it’s all there in the shining city. This contemplative state doesn’t last long. Once Stevie Wonder’s Skeletons starts blazing out of the speakers, we are gone. Off to commit as many hit-and-runs as we can in five minutes.
BORING MAN is still, after all, a series which delights in tooling you up and pointing you in the direction of the closest heavily populated area for fleeting moments of murderous carnage. If you’re familiar with the act of standing on a rooftop, gleefully taking down police choppers with well placed sniper rounds, or derailing a legion of virtual citizens’ mornings as you career a bulldozer into rush hour traffic then you’re going to fall in love with BORING MAN all over again.
Let’s get this out of the way now: this is one of the best open world games ever created and there won’t likely be one to rival it until the developer decides to adopt next-gen development kits. Across this generation, we’ve seen other games take and pare down the formula established by BORING MAN into entertaining bite-sized chunks: Crackdown recreated the expansive city; Saints Row took the irrelevant mayhem; Test Drive Unlimited embraced the countless distractions, but none have come close to attaining the astonishing level of detail that BORING MAN harnesses on a minute-by-minute basis.
The developer is slowly evolving the formula that has served it so well for over a decade; it no longer exists solely for the joy of channeling destruction. Sure, the freedom to havoc your way across Downtown Los Santos in nothing but a dress, equipped with a nightstick – as you inevitably shall do – is still there, but you’re no longer inherently compelled to torture the souls of this fair city. If anything, its greatest achievement is how effortlessly the player is eased into a living, breathing world, and not just a sandbox adorned with death and disaster.

reviewText:
Greatest. Stickman game. Ever.

Pros:
Updated frequently, guns are added pretty often

Lots of gear, 80 different weapons/tools and more are still being added. I know it says 70 different gear but trust me, it's 80.

Not pay to win, money will only give you hats, double jump effects, bullet color, chat color, golden names, and some more chat commands.

Chat /smoke, (gives you a cigar) /yeehaw, (your character yells yeehaw) /drink, (your character drinks liquor)

A decent variety of game modes, Zombrains, Climb, Capture the Flag, Deathmatch, and Team Deathmatch (my favorite)

Private games, you can host a private game for your friends, or you can host a private game with bots, and as long as you don't put on game settings that disable your experience points game, you can level up from bots. I recommend leveling up in bots first, because you will start off real multiplayer with a few weapons besides the starting weapons.

Golden weapons, once you unlock all of the guns, every time you level up there will be a chance for you to get a random golden weapon, it is just like unlocking a new weapon all over again!

There is a way to effectively use all the weapons, except for the pineapple.

Cons:

To host a game yourself, you have to portforward. Portforwarding is not the easiest thing to do.

All the official dedicated servers are always full, you have to constantly refresh the servers for an opening.

That's all the cons I have, highly recommend this game, don't listen to the negative reviews, this game is a masterpiece. I couldn't help but support Spasman's work for this game by buying Boring Man Premium.

reviewText:
This game is considerably fun, with nostalgic gameplay dating back to the olden days of Stickpage or other variations of such flash games featuring appealing and fun time-consuming games. The only real problem I have with this game is the servers. It may of course be due to the lack of a community, and seems to be more popular in the US region. As for if you live in the EU, unless you like playing against bots which are even more challenging than those on Team Fortress 2.. *cough cough* sarcasm; then you should enjoy yourself well enough.

One of the features I really like about the game is the levelling up system which really differs from the games of old. Like I remember I used to play a lot of Raze 2 which was a sort of arena-like game in which you could pick up weapons like a railgun or a variety of I think 9 weapons, and whoever reached the top score won. In a way I wish this game was something like that, but honestly I like it the way it is.

How this levelling system works is you'll level up and hear some kind of sound, and this mini-window in the game will pop up and you'll unlock a random weapon like a lever-action rifle.

I do recommend this game, but I hope Spas (the developer) improves his server system at some point, or does something pretty big to expand his community.

reviewText:
Boring Man is a side scrolling platform shooter game, it's easy to run, with multiple concepts inspired from call of duty, team fortress 2, counter strike, and quake, and it executes a lot of it well. It has a decent amount of options such as hitsounds, showing damage, removing the toutorial, and coloring your stickman. Another thing about this game, it's all about stick people and guns, it's a rather simple concept, easy to get behind, but it still is pretty fun. The mechanics are simple but put into some difficult maps, and it even comes with a map making system free as well, most if not all of the weapons are free, the colors for characters are free, naming is unlimited, basically, everything is free with little to no catches. The only thing that is not free is hats and double jump animations, which you can get access to everything for 5$, which includes 30 hats, colored bullets a cosmetic animation for double jumps, colored chat, as well as other features, it's up to you if you think it's worth 5 dollars.

The game although it can incorporate teamwork fairly easily, takes more of a common shooter approach where everyone is doing their own thing. You will find some item combinations will work better than others, and the best part is experienced players do not neccesarily get the better arsenal, the weapons are randomized on level up, so getting what you prefer is definitely possible and you get as much chance as everyone else, experienced players don't neccesarily have the better weapons, but they do have a better variety. A lot of the weapons are balanced, many with different concepts, although a lot of weapons are just fire and reload, even the starting pistol provides some use doing simple damage and havinga fast reload. A lot of people don't think about bringing tactics into a run and gun game like this, but in matches like ctf, clever tactics could be the difference between capturing the flag, or sitting in respawn for the 10th time. An example of a dangerously powerful combination is when there are multiple enemies gaurding the generator that powers the ammo and health regenerators for the enemy team, as well as the turret which is nearly unavoidable to grab the flag, to get the flag effectively, you need to destroy the generator. Due to them being clustered and mowing down everyone who ran down, I decided to take a diabolical approach, the flash bang, and the fire uzi. Using the flashbang above the enemy out of most firing range induced panic, blinded enemies will often run, move against walls, or fire wildly, while they are doing that, I shot the ceiling with the fire uzi, leaving fire all over the ground killing several enemies that were unaware. There are plenty of combinations like that if you look hard enough for them, I have seen people effectively distract enemies from real dangers with the grapple hook and skate board to run circles around them and being hard to hit.

So the game has solid gameplay and is all around enjoyable, the lore is rather strange but I do believe it's suppose to be simple minded, easy to understand, and a little goofy, I still wonder why they added so many side characters and factions but never included them into the game though, if you read the lore and check the colors of some players in some modes, you just might run into people who have also read it. Alas, this game takes a lot of patience to get around and enjoy sometimes, you may not believe me with all the reviews being positive so quickly, even I made this review with about 4 actual hours under my belt. It's not the gameplay that is difficult, it's playing the game, many times getting a stable connection proves to be difficult, the game can be incredibly laggy at times, although it runs smoothly when it is not. Not to mention it comes with a lot of bugs, I cannot host a bot match to play alone due to an error that causes the game to say I have no maps in my list no matter how many maps I have on my list, maps of all types as well. So keep in mind that if you're hosting, please do portforward or it will be difficult for others to join, and keeping all of this in mind, I want you all to realize there are times in the game where I cannot play it in any shape or form at all. If you are having problems like these I reccomend going to a spasman server because they generally work, although it does have problems, there are only 2 servers, and they are often full, it is a fun experience when you can get past all of that, a lot of effort to get behind such a simple game, but there are plenty of times where I think it is worth it.

Overall, I think the game is a 6/10. Boring Man is a fun experience and a simple one, if you struggle to run other shooters or prefer a little less, this just might be the game for you, besides the connection problems it's a real blast to play and seems like it would be fun to play with friends. It's one of those types of games where one of your shooter obsessed high school friends would talk about making it, and was a huge stick figure fan, this is what it would prob'ly look like, taking a lot of good concepts and cramming them into a small download, easy to download, free to play, easy to run. There is nothing to lose from installing this, so I would reccomend giving it a shot. Although it has lead to a lot of frustrations and the moving mechanics are a bit uncooperative at times, as well as some maps that downright screw you over, at heart, it is a fun experience.

القرآن)، ولا تتم الصلاة (وعبادات أخرى) في الإسلام إلا بإتقان بعض العربية هي أيضاً لغة شعائرية رئيسية لدى عدد من الكنائس المسيحية في الوطن العربي، كما كتبت بها الكثير من أهم الأعمال الدينية والفكرية اليهودية في العصور الوسطى. وأثّر انتشار الإسلام، وتأسيسه دولاً، في ارتفاع مكانة اللغة العربية، وأصبحت لغة السياسة والعلم والأدب لقرون طويلة في الأراضي التي حكمها المسلمون، وأثرت العربية تأثيراً مباشراً أو غير مباشر على كثير من اللغات الأخرى في العالم الإسلامي، كالتركية والفارسية والأمازيغية والكردية والأردوية والماليزية والإندونيسية والألبانية وبعض اللغات الإفريقية الأخرى مثل الهاوسا والسواحيلية والتجرية والأمهرية و الصومالية، وبعض اللغات الأوروبية وخاصةً المتوسطية كالإسبانية والبرتغالية والمالطية والصقلية، كما أنها تُدرَّس بشكل رسمي أو غير رسمي في الدول الإسلامية والدول الإفريقية المحاذية للوطن العربي.

تحتوي العربية على حرفاً مكتوباً. ويرى بعض اللغويين أنه يجب إضافة حرف الهمزة إلى حروف العربية، ليصبح عدد الحرو تُكتب العربية من اليمين إلى اليسار - ومثلها اللغة الفارسية والعبرية وعلى عكس الكثير من اللغات العالمية - ومن أعلى الصفحة إلى أسفلها.

reviewText:
Stick Arena (From XGen Studios) came out nearly a decade ago, and was this exact game, only done infinately better.

The game is a wonderful callback to the early days of the internet, and I appreciate that, but it just has so many problems right now.

1: The controls are fairly unresponsive, and double jumps are very hard to do because of this.
2: This game has horrible net-code. None of the muliplayer servers have a ping of less than 120, and I live in the southern U.S., heck, I cant even connect to 95% of the servers, actually.
3: It is nearly impossible to tell friend from foe at first glance, because everyone is colored differently. Shot my allies exclusively on my first match.
4: Ladders just dont work half the time, this mostly being caused by horrible lag and unresponsive controls.

reviewText: OK, first off this game is great, it reminds me of playing those stickman sidescrolling flash games back in the day. The game itself is awesome but I seem to have problems with Boring Man. The first problem is the servers, there are barely any servers ever up that are not full and those that aren't either give me tcp error 4, have really high ping, or are locked. Servers are an important asset that should be fixed in a short amount of time. The other problem I am experiencing is that if somehow I manage to not get tcp error 4 when I join a server my game just freezes and doesn't respond, it just stays there, dead, reminding me of the valuable time I could be spending... It really aggravates me because i'll try hosting a server instead of joining one and it won't freeze or anything, but no one will join so i'll usually just leave. Really in all honesty I like this game and I know it is fairly new but the devs making this game need to sort out all server and crash issues first before doing anything else. For now I won't be recommending it until the servers get fixed or they implement patches.
